The requirement V2G3-A06-02 ensures that the low-layer communication module never becomes the CCo

V2G3-A06-03.description: A specific requirement related to the configuration of the low-layer communication module on the EVSE side

connections.description: The requirement V2G3-A06-03 specifies how the low-layer communication module should be configured

CCO MODE.description: CCo Mode refers to a specific operational mode in a network configuration, likely related to controlling or coordinating network activities

connections.description: The APCM_SET_CCo.REQ protocol is used to configure the CCo Mode

APCM_SET_CCO.REQ.description: APCM_SET_CCo.REQ is a protocol primitive used for setting or configuring the CCo mode in a network

connections.description: The APCM_SET_CCo.REQ protocol is used to configure the CCo Mode
The APCM_SET_CCo.REQ primitive is defined within the Control SAP Service clause
The APCM_SET_CCo.REQ is a primitive defined in the HPGP standard

CONTROL SAP SERVICE.description: Control SAP Service is a process or service defined in a specific clause that involves managing or controlling network service access points

connections.description: The APCM_SET_CCo.REQ primitive is defined within the Control SAP Service clause

V2G3-A06-04.description: A specific requirement to speed up the matching process by configuring the low-layer communication module to use CAP3 priority for all related frames

connections.description: The requirement V2G3-A06-04 involves configuring the low-layer communication module to use CAP3 priority

CAP3.description: A priority level used in communication protocols to prioritize certain frames

connections.description: CAP3 priority is used to speed up the matching process
